info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 9:34PM CDT until April 7 at 2:30AM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
info.description:
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Missouri...
Current River at Van Buren affecting Carter County.
.A couple more rounds of moderate to heavy rain can be expected into the weekend. The rest of the event rainfall has been incorporated into the river forecast. The Current River has started to rise and crests are expected over the weekend. Now is the time to prepare for flooding.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Current River at Van Buren.
* WHEN...From late tonight to early Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Some flooding in low sections in town begins.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Friday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 23.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING
